header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Photography, Fears, Work, College, Comedians, Books

body.u: yeah so er I did some photography modelling for my friend and he was doing darkroom photography so

he's never actually done darkroom stuff before so he's like well hopefully I won't mess it up you know
oh yeah it's quite a process wasn't there when you were that was quite appealing for you? darkroom photography?
I mean it er seems quite cool to me but

and by layering different things you could create different like depth of light and shade on it
well no because I couldn't do it like as a proper project
because we didn't actually have the the liquid stuff to develop it in
so it would it would all just change colour completely

it was that was the only thing really

the grandson has been told he's got anaemia and that's it but he's obviously you know he's on his

but his grandfather fought in the war erm and he was at the battle of the Somme and he was erm really badly injured and he still carries these injuries or sort of you know sort of the aftermath of them to this day
and one of the things is that it it was really quite graphic and descriptive and it was a bit oh he was blown up in this field you know he went up in the air and literally he his his guts were
and er and he was left for days in the field but he was discovered and there's a reason why he kind of survived which we won't go into cos that's really that'll just make you go even more ah

but anyway there's a section of the book where Thomas the grandson he's kind of him and his friend keep going up to crab pools and blowing up crabs it's such a typical you know boy thing teenage boy thing to be doing activity
you know it's like they make all these little mini explosives and you know like my brothers used to have these little dunno if you've ever heard of them caps where you throw them on the floor
and they explode you used to be able to buy them in the shops
